text:
the claude agent sdk will do for knowledge work in 2026 what claude code did for coding in 2025.

want to live in the future?

build your own agents with it.

youâ€™ll have a personal magic tool belt that the public wonâ€™t have for another 6-12mo.

it 100% feels like personal agi.

youâ€™re like 6 prompts away from infinitely customizable personal agi.

anthropic gave you a world class agentic harness for free.

use it!!! https://t.co/5ZJq7WlCTa

the ComputerUseTool is going to launch in the next few months and every high agency person who invested time in the agent sdk will basically become a demigod overnight.

the universe calls you to master the art of commanding armies of digital intelligences born from sand.
@mckaywrigley Can I login with my Claude account and utilize my Claude sub or I need to pay by the token?
@daniel_mac8 yeah you can throw it in a vm with your claude account
@mckaywrigley If you're technical and not messing with this right now you're basically choosing to be slow
@nyn531 even if youâ€™re not technical tbh

@mckaywrigley I've been building with agents sdk but their ambiguity on it working with claude subscription long-term is worrying.  I assume it will keep working for personal use, but it's not really clearly spelled out. https://t.co/30iSOFEdib

@theLance thereâ€™s not really anything they can fundamentally do for personal use, which is good.

but anything that requires oauth they can kinda stop, and i would def not build a product thatâ€™s dependent on that flow.
@mckaywrigley Any suggestions on starting places for blank slate individuals?

@GregDNeilsen video soon that answers this.

itâ€™s admittedly a bit intimidating just bc there are SO many options

@mckaywrigley Might be more than 6-12 months. 

I just hungout with an old friend last night:
- he had never used chatgpt
- had no idea what agi was
- and ofc didn't know how god tier mckay's x posts are

@jaxonpoulton it will be publicly available, but almost nobody will use it.

agi is going to arrive and most people will just keep scrolling tiktok.
@mckaywrigley Iâ€™ve been meaning to try Claude agent sdk. What does it give me that I donâ€™t get from langchain, Langgraph, Claude code, tool-use, skills?

@idlebit itâ€™s just claude code but for general purpose agents.

the sdk gives you near full feature parity with cc, but you get to customize the entire thing.
@mckaywrigley remember when gpt-3 blew our minds? now iâ€™ve got agents handling my calendar and drafting replies while i focus on deep work, feels like having a team of assistants

@jasonth0 gpt-3 was freaking awesome and was way better than most people give it credit for.

i will die on this hill.
@mckaywrigley In your course work upcoming ðŸ‘€
@mckaywrigley If only it worked with Claude subscription... Beside that ,it's great

@waiting4agi it does. on desktop itâ€™s trivial.

sandbox requires some hackiness.
@mckaywrigley Whatâ€™s the best approach using the SDK for creative long form writing partner? Preferably Iâ€™d like to fill it with my memory exported from GPT.

fortunately a pretty straightforward use case!

youâ€™d probably just want a robust system prompt that fits how you write.

you could make a case for a few subagents or skills, but hard to say bc i donâ€™t know your workflow.

for memory just throw the export in a https://t.co/xpg8NOPtgW file.

prob useful to have a /sessions folder so that claude can save summaries of your sessions there and automatically search through it to better remember how you work.
@mckaywrigley Could you share one thing it's helping you do that was previously not achievable or where effort to get it working was not worth it?

it almost feels kind of like a new form of computing.

task in -> agent does work -> result out.

the entire middle you just donâ€™t have to worry about anymore.

so anything i do that involves me having to make decisions based on particular state and chain them together gets automated now, bc i inherently trust the harness + model enough.

itâ€™s basically a virtual employee at this point, which is kinda what i imagined agi would be?

then throw in askuserquestion paradigm of working with the agent and itâ€™s truly unbelievable how in-sync it is with you.

instead of doing something fundamentally new itâ€™s moreso just a fundamentally new way of working. you do the same stuff, but itâ€™s better and faster and a model smarter than you outperforms what you couldâ€™ve done.
